summary: This is an email from an unnamed sender to Jay Lefkowitz regarding the Jeffrey Epstein case. It states that the Deputy Attorney General has completed a review and determined federal prosecution is appropriate, and gives Epstein until June 30, 2008, to comply with the terms of a modified agreement, including pleading guilty, being sentenced, and surrendering to begin his prison sentence.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the email; the individual who must comply with a modified agreement to plead guilty, be sentenced, and surrender to begin a prison sentence by June 30, 2008.

persons.name: Jay Lefkowitz
persons.context: The email is addressed to him, and he is informed of the Deputy Attorney General's decision and the deadline for Epstein's compliance.

connections.description: Lefkowitz is the recipient of an official communication regarding the legal deadline and requirements for Epstein's case, suggesting he is acting in a legal capacity for Epstein.

events.title: Deadline for Epstein's Compliance
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein has until the close of business on this date to comply with the terms of a modified agreement, including entering a guilty plea, being sentenced, and surrendering to begin his prison sentence.

events.title: U.S. Attorney's Letter Modifying Agreement
events.description: A letter from the U.S. Attorney modified the agreement between the United States and Jeffrey Epstein.

keyFacts: The Deputy Attorney General completed a review and determined federal prosecution of Jeffrey Epstein was appropriate.
Epstein was given a deadline of June 30, 2008, to comply with a modified agreement, which required him to plead guilty, be sentenced, and surrender to begin a prison sentence.
The agreement between the United States and Epstein was previously modified by a U.S. Attorney's letter dated December 19th of an unspecified year (likely 2007).
The correspondence is directed to Jay Lefkowitz, indicating his involvement in Epstein's legal affairs at this critical juncture.
